ygData.subject: Clerics in Bristlebane-More
ygData.msgSnippet: I too must sing the praises of Drugar!  He also did a Bind for me and it has helped immensely.  I must warn you though, if you decide to hunt the common
ygData.messageBody:
I too must sing the praises of Drugar! He also did a "Bind" for me
and it has helped immensely. I must warn you though, if you decide to
hunt the common lands, do so after you have a "bind" done: the
Griffons strike without warning and do more damage than guards do in a
single swipe of their claws! I have been felled 4 times by Griffons,
but thanks to Drugar, it was no major catastrophe, only a minor
inconvenience. Good Luck! and Fare Thee Well!
Zardoz, High Elven Mage.


----Original Message Follows----
From: Ratsmak106@...
Reply-To: Bristlebane_EQ@onelist.com
To: Bristlebane_EQ@onelist.com
Subject: [Bristlebane_EQ] Re: Clerics in Bristlebane
Date: Thu, 8 Apr 1999 13:31:02 EDT

From: Ratsmak106@...

Fellow troubled cleric,

I can only share with you my experience, but from what it sounds like
there's
a simple fix - get bound to Freeport, find a nice big group that needs
a
cleric like yourself, and go hunting tarantulas and mummies in the
desert.
Ward undead works well in this case, and there are many groups formed
all of
the time by the fishing huts. As for getting bound, ask Drugar, he
bound me
to Freeport for only a platinum (and had the kindness to wait while I
stumbled about the maze that is Freeport city). If you do venture into
the
deserts, I warn you to watch out for that character Dorn. He beat me
up good,
and his buddies didn't look very friendly either.

Good luck,
Fenwen
